function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through wearable devices and environmental sensors in the home hospitalization system.","Impact":"Increased risk of COVID-19 transmission and other contagious diseases among patients, healthcare staff, and family members.","Mitigation":"Regular cleaning and sterilization of wearable devices and environmental sensors, strict hygiene protocols for healthcare staff and family members, and use of antimicrobial materials in device construction.","Technologies":"Antimicrobial materials for wearable devices, advanced sterilization methods, and real-time monitoring of device cleanliness.","People":"Patients, healthcare staff, family members.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, device manufacturers."},{"Description":"Lack of awareness and education about the use of IoT-based devices and mobile applications in the context of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Risk of improper use, leading to increased vulnerability to contagious diseases and potential spread of infection.","Mitigation":"Comprehensive educational programs for patients, healthcare staff, and family members on the proper use and maintenance of IoT-based devices, and clear communication of hygiene protocols.","Technologies":"Interactive educational modules, IoT device tutorials, and remote support for device users.","People":"Patients, healthcare staff, family members.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, technology providers."},{"Description":"Challenges in implementing cost-effective sensing units for low-income patients.","Impact":"Limited access to advanced medical monitoring systems for low-income patients, leading to healthcare disparities.","Mitigation":"Research and development of affordable sensing units, government subsidies or financial assistance programs, and partnerships with social organizations for device distribution.","Technologies":"Low-cost sensor technologies, cost-effective IoT solutions, and community-driven distribution models.","People":"Low-income patients, healthcare providers, government agencies.","Owner":"Device manufacturers, government agencies, social organizations."}]}
